author: taulepton_
content: High-level question <@792404665068158998> , in the future could we optimise the protocol so that the bid does not need to commit to a specific block? This would give them more freedom / time to generate the block?

author: nero_eth
content:
this has been discussed under "slot autction" (instead of block auction).
The problem was that proposers could commit to themselves and then sell their "right to build" a few seconds later into the slot - essentially timing games is what makes this difficult

author: taulepton_
content: ahhh ok that makes sense, thanks for the explanation

author: taulepton_
content: Is there anything wrong with the secondary market?

author: nero_eth
content: it might encourage validators to delay their proposal, not using the full time they have, thus building less full blocks
